H0.text: Retaining walls are helpful for keeping a slope stable.

H1.text: Relocating walls are helpful for keeping a slope stable.

H2.text: Diverting walls are helpful for keeping a slope stable.

H3.text: Managing walls are the type of walls that help keep a slope stable.

A4.text: Retaining walls are structures designed to restrain soil to a slope that it would not naturally keep to (typically a steep, near-vertical or vertical slope).

A5.text: The most important consideration in proper design and installation of retaining walls is to recognize and counteract the tendency of the retained material to move downslope due to gravity.
